a man who free from ill-will, jealosy, etc.
free from conceit, arrogance, haughtiness, etc.
= ನಿರ್ಗರ್ವತೆ.
absence of arrogance, haughtiness, etc.; humility.
a person who is free from arrogance, haughtiness, etc.; a humble person.
flowed out; moved gently or smoothly.
the quality or condition of being easy to do, get, understand; easiness.
absence of fatigue, difficulty etc.
= ನಿರ್ಗಲಿತ.
he who is not dull or mentally slow; an intelligent man.
a place not having air or gas; vacuum.
the tree Vitex negundo of Verbenaceae family.
a particular custom followed by jaina mendicants.
not stringed; not having a string or cord.
not having attributes.
that (as a bow) which is not stringed.
a formless thing.
a ruthless, punctilious man.
the Supreme Being.
a being completely absorbed in abstract meditation.
the quality of being attributeless; absoluteness.
the state of a thing (as of the Supreme Being) that cannot be attributed with any qualities, characteristics, etc.
absence of good or desirable qualities.
the condition of being not stringed, tied with a cord, rope, etc.
= ನಿರ್ಗುಣತೆ.
the Absolute, which is the ultimate reality regarded as uncaused, unmodified, unified and complete, timeless, etc,; the Supreme Being.
he who holds the doctrine that the ultimate reality is the Absolute or attributeless Supreme Being.
the knowledge of the Absolute.
the ardent belief in or devotion to the Absolute Being.
= ನಿರ್ಗಂಧವಾಯು.
the holy scriptures as the Vedas, that uphold the doctrine that the ultimate reality is the Absolute or attributeless Brahman.
a meditating or reflecting on the Absolute Brahman.
a man lacking good qualities; a base, despicable man.
he who is beyond the qualities as good, bad, etc.
he who meditates on the Absolute Brahman.
she who meditates on the Absolute Brahman.
= ನಿರ್ಗುಣಾರಾಧನೆ.
